meanings.definition: To intimidate or overawe (someone) with a display of strength or confidence.
meanings.sent1: The large wrestler was buffaloing his opponent with his imposing presence.
meanings.sent2: She was buffaloing the audience with her powerful speech.
meanings.sent3: The little dog was buffaloing the cat by barking loudly.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were buffaloing the small town with their dark and ominous appearance.
meanings.sent5: The teacher buffaloed the students into silence with just a stern look.

meanings.definition: To deceive or confuse (someone) with misleading or irrelevant information.
meanings.sent1: The scammer was buffaloing unsuspecting victims with false promises.
meanings.sent2: He was buffaloing his friends with a made-up story about his adventures.
meanings.sent3: The magician was buffaloing the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent4: The mirage buffaloed the travelers into thinking they had reached an oasis.
meanings.sent5: The politician buffaloed the voters with empty promises during the campaign.
